name: tris(3-methoxyphenyl)phosphine
Reason: 3-methoxyphenyl groups are attached to a phosphorus atom in tris(3-methoxyphenyl)phosphine. The melting point of the compound can be estimated by considering the effects of the functional groups and the phosphorus atom. The basic unit, phenyl, has a melting point of around 25 degrees Celsius. The methoxy group increases the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces, contributing approximately +10 degrees Celsius. The phosphorus atom increases the melting point due to its larger size and the ability to form more intermolecular interactions, contributing approximately +50 degrees Celsius. The three 3-methoxyphenyl groups will each contribute around +10 degrees Celsius, giving a total increase of (10 degrees Celsius x 3) = 30 degrees Celsius. The overall melting point is the sum of the individual contributions.
